entry.summary: A while ago, I saw a post on Twitter that had some fancy beams of light emanating out from behind the main image. It looked like a meteor was blazing softly behind the card, and I thought it was a really cool UI component to have in a project.

entry.title: Designing Accessible Text Over Images: Best Practices, Techniques, And Resources (Part 2)
entry.summary: In Part 2 of the series, Hannah Milan reviews in detail various accessible text over images techniques for designing your web and mobile app content, including framing the image, soft-colored gradients technique, text styles and text position, solid color shapes, and use of colored backgrounds. And finally, the emphasis will once again be placed on the accessibility aspect, which needs to be â€œbaked inâ€ right from the start rather than being an afterthought in your design process.

And speaking of *measuring* performance, thereâ€™s quite a difference between that and *monitoring* performance. Letâ€™s dig in!

entry.summary: Deploying your application is a key aspect of software development. Typically, having an app on your local system isn't enough â€“ it needs to be accessible online. So choosing a suitable and user-friendly hosting and deployment plan is vital. The key to making the right decision lies in understanding the

entry.title: Using Friction As A Feature In Machine Learning Algorithms
entry.summary: Friction often has a negative connotation in user experience design, but it actually has many benefits. Its best-known use case is mitigating unintended consequences in high-risk scenarios, yet it has a new place in the age of artificial intelligence. Adding strategic friction to interfaces can lead to profound efficiency gains in machine learning algorithms.

entry.title: Designing Accessible Text Over Images: Best Practices, Techniques, And Resources (Part 1)
entry.summary: In this two-part series of articles, Hannah Milan covers the best practices when using various accessible text over images techniques for designing your web and mobile app content.

entry.title: How We Optimized Performance To Serve A Global Audience
entry.summary: Liran Cohen and the team at Bookaway, a travel booking service, dramatically improved their siteâ€™s performance by auditing Core Web Vitals. In this article, Liran shares his teamâ€™s process for auditing and monitoring Web Vitals and the effort it took to dramatically improve Bookawayâ€™s performance â€” and the benefits that came with it.

entry.title: Smashing Podcast Episode 64 With Alvin Bryan: What Is A Headless CMS?
entry.summary: Weâ€™re talking about headless content management systems. What are they, and how do they differ from more traditional systems? Drew McLellan talks to Alvin Bryan to find out.

entry.title: CSS And Accessibility: Inclusion Through User Choice
entry.summary: In this article, Carie Fisher outlines which CSS media features are available for detecting user preferences and how they are used to design and build more inclusive user experiences.

entry.title: Living In The Moment (August 2023 Wallpapers Edition)
entry.summary: New month, new wallpapers! In this post, youâ€™ll find unique and inspiring wallpapers for August 2023. Created with love by the community for the community, they come in versions with and without a calendar. Enjoy!

entry.title: How To Define An Array Of Colors With CSS
entry.summary: Join Temani Afif on experiment with modern CSS features to create an array of colors. The goal is to define a comma-separated list of colors and iterate through them using an index.

entry.title: How To Use Artificial Intelligence And Machine Learning To Summarize Chat Conversations
entry.summary: In this article, weâ€™ll explore how to build a chat summarizer using the Cohere API and deploy it as a web application using Gradio.[ Cohere](https://cohere.com/) is an AI platform that provides state-of-the-art natural language processing models for a variety of tasks, including summarization. Weâ€™ll cover the steps involved in training the summarizer using sample chat conversations, interacting with the Cohere API to generate summaries, and creating a user-friendly interface using [Gradio](https://www.gradio.app/).

entry.title: Modern Technology And The Future Of Language Translation
entry.summary: The field of language translation has never been more exciting. Explore the evolution of language translation platforms, how we got to where we are today, and what advancements we can look forward to in the coming years.

entry.title: Recreating YouTubeâ€™s Ambient Mode Glow Effect
entry.summary: In this article, Adrian deconstructs YouTubeâ€™s â€œAmbient Modeâ€ feature and how HTML `` and the `requestAnimationFrame` function are used to create the glowing effect.

entry.title: The Art Of Looking Back: A Critical Reflection For Individual Contributors
entry.summary: Discover the importance of critical reflective practice and challenge some beliefs about reflection and its role in our work and growth. Kristian Mikhel suggests a critical reflective routine for individual contributors and gives some practical recommendations that will make reflection meaningful and actionable.

entry.title: Designing Age-Inclusive Products: Guidelines And Best Practices
entry.summary: With an estimated one in every eight individuals worldwide surpassing the age of 60, who are actively adopting online shopping, the need for user-friendly interfaces tailored to their needs becomes apparent. Explore the guidelines to help you design inclusive products for all, particularly for an older audience and your future self.
